title: Syllabus mentioned in ERP
text: Prerequisite: CY41003, CY41002Use of random numbers to evaluate area under a curve.Application of numerical methods to solve differential equations.Quantum chemical calculations for simple molecular systems.Code development to evaluate potential energy and force acting on complex molecules in a system.Development of a classical MD code for simple monatomic systems.Development of a classical Metropolis MC code for simple monatomic systems. Use of various commercially available molecular modeling and simulation software.Books: Computer Simulation of Liquids, by M. P. Allen and D. J. Tildesley; Clarendon Press (Oxford). Understanding Molecular Simulations: From Algorithms to Applications, by D. Frenkel and B. Smit (Academic Press); Molecular modeling by A.R. Leach.
